name: pfetch-rs
description: Pretty system information tool written in Rust

repo.name: pfetch-rs
repo.description: A rewrite of the pfetch system information tool in Rust

readme.summary: Clear explanation and installation instructions, but critically lacks any usage examples showing how to actually run the tool.
readme.top_issue: No quick start or basic usage example - doesn't show the command to run pfetch-rs after installation

injection_risks.description: The `dotenvy::var` function is used to retrieve environment variables, which could potentially be tampered with. However, the code does not seem to execute any shell commands or SQL queries directly with user input.
The `pfetch::logo` function is called with a logo name that could be overridden by an environment variable. While this might not be directly exploitable, it's still worth noting.

security.summary: The code has some potential security issues related to input validation and error handling, but no critical vulnerabilities were found.

common_complaints: Package manager support gaps (Winget, Chocolatey, Solus eopkg)
Custom logo rendering and alignment issues
Configuration and environment variable handling inconsistencies
praise_themes: Tool quality and usability appreciated by users
Active community requests for new OS/distro support
sentiment.summary: pfetch-rs shows healthy community engagement with moderate maintainer responsiveness, though several feature requests remain unaddressed and some bugs persist around logo handling and package manager support.

communication.summary: Maintainer responses are generally clear, helpful, and patient, with a good balance of technical depth and welcoming tone.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being from February 2025
12 open issues with no recent activity to address them
Zero closed issues in past 6 months indicating no maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing lack of development
No active contributors in past 6 months
No releases recorded, suggesting no version updates
positive_signals: Repository exists and has a history of commits
maintenance.summary: The project appears stale with no maintenance activity for at least 6 months, accumulating unaddressed issues while receiving no updates or contributions.

changelog.summary: The changelog is well-organized and clearly marks breaking changes, but lacks migration guides.

project_metrics.description: A rewrite of the pfetch system information tool in Rust

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally well-structured and informative, but lacks a quick start example and troubleshooting guidance.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of active development.
12 open issues and no merged PRs or closed issues in the past six months suggest an accumulation of unresolved problems.
Docs: Lack of troubleshooting section and quick start example
High bus factor risk (87% from top contributor)
highlights: 7 contributors have been active in the past six months, which shows some level of community involvement.
Breaking changes clearly marked in changelog
